ratings.comment: I only had Gloria as a sub one time, but just from that one class I can tell that she's a good professor, which is a rare sight here @ UW. I wanted to post this review and point out that most of the negative reviews about Gloria are from younger students who took calc 1/2 with her, and that they likely weren't anticipating college math to be hard.

Gloria is a funny lady but a HORRIBLE teacher. I took calculus in high school and understood it just fine, then took it with Gloria and became more confused about things I already had some questions on. Unless you have a decent TA, I suggest getting a tutor or a different professor. Worst professor I've had thus far. Avoid at all cost.

She obviously is a very intelligent person, but she does not know how to teach the material. Homework, lecture, quizzes, and the midterms never seemed to be connected. Requires a lot of work and studying on your own if you want to do well. The final was a lot easier than the midterms though which helped my grade greatly.

Her exams are all fair, but if you don't get a good ta it can be very difficult. Shes not very good at giving examples so you have to learn a lot of variations on problems by yourself. Passable if you work hard.
Tests were fair. But her class was pretty hard to follow, previous calculus classes are necessary to follow what she's talking about.

Awful, her lectures were extremely hard to follow and she never answered questions during class well. She presumed all of us already knew the information she was teaching and always presumed the student to be wrong.

Gloria loves what she teaches and encourages class participation.Her tests are very doable especially if you understand the concepts and don't just memorize specific problems.Don't get too caught up reading or trying to understand the packet/textbook~you'll only really need to use it for the homework.Also, a good TA will make your calc life easy.

Gloria is a very nice person and is one of the better 221 professors. A lot of people complaining don't understand that this is a 5-credit 200 level math class. I suggest anyone taking 221 to take it seriously if they want a good grade. I never had Calc before and I struggled so much on the first midterm. Just be prepared to put in a lot of time

I counted, she sent the class 115 emails within 26 days, or 4.5 emails per day. These range from irrelevant to critical, but you have to read all of them or you will be deeply misinformed in this incredibly disorganized and innately difficult course. The sheer quantity of emails sent by her is maddening and nearly violates the eighth amendment.

This class was very difficult and the professor had too many students at once so never really answered any emails, but it is pretty much a required course for most majors so it is just something to get through.

The tests were easier than the homework, but she uses a lot of variables in place of numbers which can become very confusing. She wants you to know why an answer is correct and how to explain it with math... She does very few examples during class, but is extremely helpful during office hours.
The book is NO help. Her tests are very difficult and require more help than is offered (unless you find a tutor). If you don't have a great T.A. you're basically on your own.

Gloria sends so many useless emails per week, and contradicts herself with homework and grading and is constantly changing the way she styles the class and its just confusing. Accent is thick, but not too hard where you can't understand. I feel like she is a hit or miss, I personally did not like having her so much, but some people really liked her

Everyone who rates this prof. so lowly needs to understand that 221 is a DIFFICULT class. She teaches heavily on theory, but that's how you learn calc.  I took BC calc. in high school and didn't pass a single test; my teacher didn't teach theory. I get to this class and I understand calc much better. She's great if you plan on continuing math.

Received 36 Emails in the month of December by the 16th. I wish it was just because of finals, but this is not unusual, most are worthless. She is very unprofessional. Most of the emails were about errors in the final exam practice problem set that were found by students. There were around 10 errors with the study guide. She is not a good teacher.

I should say this professor is good at math but she is absolutely not good at teaching.The exams are extremely difficult.Practice exams and homeworks are useless. Hard to understand accent. AVOID HER IF YOU DO NOT WANT TO LOWER YOUR GPA!
She can make the lecture more fun than an ordinary professor, but her exams are very difficult. If you haven't taken Calculus already in high school, DO NOT take this class
my high school notes from calculus were more useful than her lectures. Awful at describing things. Skips steps on board. exams are extremely difficult.

If you have prior calc experience you are more fortunate than the rest. I came in already taking AP Calc in high school and I was annoyed how she assumes everyone already knows everything and skips explanations why she is doing what. Her exams are so different from the homework and practice problems given and aren't given efficient time to finish.

As a person, she is okay, but her exams are very confusing and I feel as the semester progressed she helped less and less. She assigns homework on many different days which is not helpful and messes with my busy schedule. She does not explain well and if you go to her office hours for help, she just sits there and tells you to think about it.

I came into the class ready to learn and improve my math skills. But as the semester has progressed I have become more and more annoyed by how little she helps with her teaching style. She assumes every student knows so much as speeds through material. Her exams are so different from the homework and practice problems given. AVOID HER.

She is smart, but insists we know everything in one lecture. She can be confusing at times, but she is very intelligent to teach. She would be great teaching other higher-level courses, but Calculus 1 should not be something she should teach freshmen who are being introduced to Calc. Few examples are given to prove her point, exams mainly hard.

Her homework has almost nothing to do with what she taught in lecture, she is very confusing she knows math but is horrible teacher and her packet "textbook" seems like it was written by her cause it is equally unhelpful. she makes calculus way harder than it should be. never take her class!
Her lectures are useless, she understands math too in depth to explain it, and she gives no instruction on solving the problems she assigns for homework.
Course was easy, but tests were only concerned with having the theorems memorized, not with solving problems.

Let me first start off by saying that people who post bad reviews of Prof. Beffa are obviously people who don't give a sh*t about learning. She'll kick your ass. She'll make you actually understand the theory, not just the examples. She's a hard teacher but you're in college TO LEARN. As a side note she's a really sweet person and is always helpful

By far my favorite professor. Her love of math is infectious, and she is so helpful both in and out of class. The fast pace of the class was what made it difficult rather than the depth of the material, but she is very clear on the subject matter and knows how to appeal to the inner mathematicians in her students. I'm definitely a math major now.

This is a very hard and fast paced class but Gloria was very good at explaining (certainly much better than the textbook).  Going to class is a must if you want to do well.  This class made me like math so much more than before.

This is a tough class. No matter who you take it with, it's hard. Materials are covered extremely quickly. Even if you were the smartest kid in your high school math classes, this class won't be easy. Many times, you might get lost during lecture. However, Professor Mari-beffa is extremely helpful during office hours. She is always happy to help.
If you have prior calc knowlege, she is a great professor. However, if you do not and are new to the material, her teaching methods may not be for you

I do NOT recommend this professor. First, to her credit she is nice and enthused at all classes. It is also apparent that she knows her stuff. But she does not do well at communicating new concepts to students. She relies on lofty math terms and proofs without first giving any intuitive explanations. She does not understand how to teach new things.

Prof. Mari-Beffa was great. To everyone reading other comments: she now uses a textbook since the Math department forced her to standardize with other profs.  The textbook is great for seeing examples, but M-B does plenty of examples in class.  She is usually enthusiastic which makes a dry Calculus class bearable.  Much recommended

I love this class and the way Mari-Beffa teaches. The notes are a million times better than Thomas (which is the most useless calc textbook ever, IMO). Take a look at her old exams, they're almost always exactly the same. Most people I know who didn't like the class didn't like it because they were lazy and didn't want to do any work.

Professor Mari-Beffa's class was pretty hard. She does not use a textbook which makes it very hard to know if you are doing the homework correctly. The notes she uses are confusing and not helpful. She does not grade on a standard curve which makes the class very hard (86 or above is an A). She requires group work which is very time consuming.

The notes used have no examples in them or answers to odd questions so it is impossible to know if you are getting the right answers or even working them out correctly.  Become a fan of learning stuff for yourself and it will be ok.  I had to look everything up online and look for step by step processes.

I like the way Mari-Beffa teaches. I personally like using the notes instead of a textbook, and groupwork is helpful to understand concepts and get to know people in your discussion. It's a lot easier to learn when you have a good TA who goes over the material from lecture in more detail. Tests are a little hard, but she loves answering questions.

Lecture notes instead of a textbook were hard to get used to at first, but I liked them after a few weeks. Her husband writes the notes (he's a math teacher here too), so she knows them well -- better than most profs know the book. Tests are fair and much like the practices exams. This is a tough class, but she teaches it well.

Dr. Mari-Beffa does a fantastic job. She?s clearly very excited by what she does, and explains things very well. She doesn?t  ?go by the book,? per se, but she has really made me love calculus. I highly recommend her...IF you want to work hard and like math. :)
Pray for a good TA. It's the only way you'll get an A.

Class notes that are used in place of a textbook are awful. I recommend getting a textbook and teaching yourself or getting tutoring. It is hard to learn from the notes unless you already know the material. I would definitely avoid taking this class. Horrible teacher.
She does not explain things very well and you have to teach yourself or get a tutor. Not having a textbook is very difficult and never take this class with other difficult classes.

This class was much harder than I expected, even with prevoius calc classes.  She often goes over the material quickly, and if you have a question she either refuses to answer it, claiming that she'll get to it later, or give a convoluted exlpaination that nobody understands.
her english isn't very understandable at times

This professor is absolutely worthless. I haven't learned anything from lecture, even with previous calc experience. We don't use a book, just unclear notes that confuse more than clarify. If you have a good TA, the class will be manageable, but with a terrible one, like the one I was blessed with, this class will be a very big challenge.
Great teacher!!, her lectures are always lively and she tries and gets everyone to participate. The bonus points are great too.
She's awesome!!Her class is really helpful and entertaining too!
Notes used in place of the textbook are lacking in examples... hard class!
She is a very good professor.  The material is hard.  Office hours are recommended.  Tests are tricky sometimes.

A wonderful professor!  She kept the class engaged and made it challenging, without overwhelming us.  She was very helpful, inside and outside of class, and also was quite funny and entertaining.  She is great!  Take her if you can!
Made class far more difficult than necessary.

She use's a textbook which gives no solutions to its problems, so you never know if you're doing the problems correctly without seeing her or TA every chance you get. She goes over material VERY fast and can never simplify her explanations, does few  practice problems. If you get her, sign up for tutoring.
Excellent professor! She is smart, funny and knows how to teach. Realistic student expectations. Take her!
Hard to understand, doesn't use book just useless notes

I loved Professor Mari-Beffa. She made calculus entertaining and kept lectures interesting. Reading her notes may be confusing at first, but she explains them very well in lecture. I would definitely recommend her!
Switch.  Unclear, says 'ambiguous' a lot, assumes you know more than you should.  Uses her own lecture notes with few practice problems, all of which are 'ambiguous.'

I found this professor to be very hard to understand in class, and she moves very fast.  The notes she uses instead of the textbook are vague and hard to learn from.  The homework is difficult in itself, nevermind the exams which differ greatly. Very hard course, I would not reccomend unless math is a natural gift to you.

If you are someone who needs examples... try to not have her as a professor. She uses notes another professor made and its very unhelpful and only a bunch of theorems and basic examples yet the homework is almost impossible without clarification from your TA... so you better hope you have a helpful TA.
Excellent professor.  Teaches very clearly and precisely.  Difficult course, but learned a lot.  Shares interesting anecdotes, as well.
She made class interesting with random stories and funny comments
She is entertaining and easy to understand.  She is also friendly and easy to approach, as well as being very good at explaining things.

For a tough topic, she taught rather well (both semesters, 375/6). However, she tends to make jumps at times - it's up to you to stop her and ask her if you have a question. She is also the head math advisor - it shows if you go to her office hours; she is more than happy to help. Just make sure to bring questions w/ you. Good professor, overall.
I didn't fall a sleep in her class.  Your Grade is only based on Exams and If you **** up on one b/c they are hard you won't catch up on the grade you want. I thought she was better than Nigel
A math prof who actually has fun teaching... Funny stories and helpful - if you stop her/slow her down at times for an extra explanation.
She is a really nice lady with some fun stories to tell but she teaches things in a manner that is difficult to follow. There is no text book and no answers to the homework. Exams are hard.

She is hard to understand and doesnt use a book. She only uses notes that some other professor wrote and there are little to no examples in it. tests are hard and no answers to the homework are given. in my opinion, choose someone else

She's got a cool spanish accent, but she explains everything in a really round about manner. She's a fine prof. i guess, but I'd personally suggest a different prof. 'cause I just couldn't understand what she was trying to teach during lecture half the time.
